PageTitle: info-center logbuffer size (Virtual access port-extension view)
FuncDef:
The info-center logbuffer size command configures the maximum number of AP logs to be displayed.
The undo info-center logbuffer size command restores the default number of AP logs to be displayed.
By default, a maximum of 512 logs are displayed on an AP.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of logs to be displayed.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 10240.
If buffersize is set to 0, no log will be displayed.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure the maximum number of AP logs to be displayed in a virtual access port extension scenario, run the info-center logbuffer size command.
To set the number of logs to be displayed, run the info-center logbuffer size command.
Configuration Impact
If this command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
Precautions
If the number of logs to be displayed is set too small, some logs cannot be queried. If the number of logs to be displayed is set too large, some logs cannot be displayed in a screen. The default number of logs to be displayed is recommended.
